column4: hello,can anyone help me how to install mono-devel.This package is not in the synaptic

i'm trying to build nm from source
yes, and...?
install what it asks for.
ya tried,it says the version is already the newest.see this  http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/JA1TfjaP
ok, you're close, but missing the point :) It says it is missing the wirelesstools development files. Not wireless tools itself
wait, let me see which package it is
how to proceed
I think I found the package, but let me show you: Go to http://packages.ubuntu.com, enter "wireless development" in searchbox, tick the descriptions and it'll show up with relevant packages
my guess is you need package "libiw-dev"
sorry my network is slow
its asking for dbus
No package 'dbus-1' found

If you insist on rebuilding/compiling it yourself, restart your search at packages.ubuntu.com, and find all dependencies you need. Could be lots of work, that is why we recommend to use packages from the repositories
